availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Kallaher (Indianapolis, Indiana, day laborer and soldier)

body.p: Indianapolis, Indiana, day laborer and soldier. Native of Ireland. Day laborer in Indianapolis, Indiana, in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from September 22, 1862 to May 24, 1864. Killed in action in Bartow County, Georgia, on May 24, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Marion County, Indianapolis, Ward 7, p. 609.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0109.
"James Kallaher (1827-1864)," Find A Grave, Memorial 135918591, accessed October 2, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/135918591.
